<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/mackenzie-scott-donates-another-27b-bringing-total-almost-9b?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Great Scott!
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/mackenzie-scott-donates-another-27b-bringing-total-almost-9b?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A photograph of MacKenzie Scott from the shoulders up. She is smiling at the camera with her hair falling in loose waves around her face." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDQ5L2RvX25vdF91c2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Taylor Hill/FilmMagic via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, MacKenzie Scott announced she <a href="https://www.axios.com/mackenzie-scott-donation-7f936f59-2ab7-4616-b824-bafe6cbf4ce7.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">donated</a> $2.7 billion to 286 organizations working to address issues including poverty, racial equity, and higher education.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In her 2019 divorce settlement with Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, Scott received a 4% slice of Amazon, which was worth $36 billion at the time. Thanks to the company's rising valuation, today she's the world's 20th wealthiest person.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But she's not like other billionaires</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The speed and volume of Scott's giving, as well as the types of organizations she's supporting, is "highly unconventional," the NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/15/business/mackenzie-scott-philanthropy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Instead of splashing her name across a big foundation or philanthropic effort like, just for the sake of example, her ex-husband's Bezos Earth Fund, Scott focuses on direct giving to smaller institutions that may be passed over by the biggest donors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year, she <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/features/2021-bezos-scott-philanthropy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dispersed</a> $6 billion in what is believed to be a record annual sum by a living person. And there's plenty more where that came from: Like some other billionaires who have pledged to give away their fortune, Scott's wealth continues to grow faster than she can spend it; Forbes estimates her current net worth at $60 billion.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Will Jeff follow suit? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2020, Bezos created a $10 billion climate change fund and announced the first ~$800 million in grants. He's expected to be slower dishing out his fortune while he decides how to maximize its impact.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But donations from Scott's and Bezos's Amazon fortunes can be a catch-22 for activists, who on the one hand may not want money tinted by a large carbon footprint and allegations of labor abuse...but on the other hand could really use the funds.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>As a recent ProPublica report reminded us, many billionaires' wealth is structured in such a way that they <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/08/propublica-estimates-richest-25-individuals-pay-34-tax-rate?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pay next to nothing</a> in income taxes. Scott acknowledged wealth disparities in a Medium post announcing her donations yesterday, writing, "It would be better if disproportionate wealth were not concentrated in a small number of hands, and that the solutions are best designed and implemented by others."</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/retail-sales-fall-13-consumers-turn-goods-services?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Experience Economy Is Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Retail sales <a href="https://apnews.com/article/retail-sales-health-coronavirus-pandemic-business-493f964f22362fbc5fc97f895b6f408b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell 1.3%</a> in May, which may not seem that important or interesting until you consider how it reflects major changes in the post-Covid economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's going on: </strong>People are paying less for <em>things</em>, like sweatpants, and more for <em>experiences</em>, like things you shouldn't do in sweatpants. This is the opposite of what happened during the pandemic, when people could really only buy...things. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To illustrate the point, restaurant sales have <a href="https://twitter.com/jonathanmaze/status/1404896377566601216/photo/1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">eclipsed</a> grocery sales for the first time since March of last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDUxL3Jlc3RhdXJhbnRfc2FsZXNfdnNfZ3JvY2VyeV9zYWxlc19jaGFydC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Restaurant sales vs. grocery sales chart" data-source="Restaurant Business" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Restaurant Business</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Less spending on goods and more spending on services could bring <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-15/u-s-retail-sales-decline-after-two-solid-months-of-gains?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">better balance</a> to the off-kilter economy. The surge in demand for physical products last year caused supply chains to become more tangled than your headphones, sending consumer prices higher. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Along with alleviating pressure on supply chains, more services spending means people are finally enjoying experiences they couldn't during the pandemic, like vacations and live music.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Consumer spending has rebounded from the 2020 recession, but stimulus payments, supply chain bottlenecks, and business reopenings are clouding the long-term picture. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/pwc-plans-grow-workforce-100000?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Big Four's Getting Bigger
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/pwc-plans-grow-workforce-100000?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="LONDON, ENGLAND - OCTOBER 02: The PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) offices s..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDQ4L2JpZ19mb3VyX2FjY291bnRpbmdfZmlybXMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jack Taylor/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A quarter of the Big Four accounting firms is getting about one-third bigger, to be more precise. Yesterday, PwC said it'll spend $12 billion to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/pwc-to-spend-12-billion-on-hiring-expanding-expertise-in-ai-cybersecurity-11623758400?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grow its workforce</a>, which currently stands at 284,000, by 100,000 over the next five years.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Where will those hires come from?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1) The Asia-Pacific region, where PwC plans to double its presence</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2) 10,000 from its college mentorship program for Black and Latino students</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3) Candidates with experience in ESG (environmental, social, and governance) and artificial intelligence/machine learning</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">PwC also plans to shake up some of its current workforce by combining its accounting and tax services divisions into a new unit called "trust solutions." Following Big Four scandals involving tax shelters and sketchy auditing practices, the firm is looking to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/15/business/dealbook/pwc-trust-leadership.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rebuild clients' trust</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FYI, PwC's revenue growth is slowing, and it ranks third among the Big Four in market share. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>PwC is betting that helping clients with their diversity and sustainability initiatives will be key to its competitiveness.</p>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/key-performance-indicators-june-16?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="a photo of iced coffee" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODEwL3Jfci5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Dimitras Dishes</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Turns out your morning brew can deliver business news in five minutes <em>and</em> reduce your probability of death. Studies show that people who drank three-to-five cups of coffee a day were 15% less likely to die early from all causes, and moderate coffee drinkers showed a 50% reduction in suicide risk, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/14/well/eat/coffee-health-benefits.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the NYT</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “If you want to get paid New York rates, you work in New York. None of this, ‘I'm in Colorado and work in New York and am getting paid like I'm sitting in New York City.’”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman wants to see employees back at the bank's offices by Labor Day or else <a href="https://nypost.com/2021/06/15/morgan-stanley-chief-expects-bankers-back-in-nyc-offices/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">face a pay cut</a>. “If you can go into a restaurant in New York City, you can come into the office,” he said at a conference yesterday, echoing other top bank chiefs who are over remote work.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Decadence and Andreessen's dilemma. (<a href="https://douthat.substack.com/p/decadence-and-andreessens-dilemma?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ross Douthat</a>)</p>

<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/spotify-buys-exclusive-rights-call-daddy-podcast?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Call Spotify Daddy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/spotify-buys-exclusive-rights-call-daddy-podcast?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Call Her Daddy" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=375 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YpSX1sVxtbEpJGz9Q3/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Call Her Daddy" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YpSX1sVxtbEpJGz9Q3/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy/Instagram</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And only Spotify. The not-just-music streamer has purchased the exclusive rights to the <em>Call Her Daddy</em> podcast from Barstool Sports. Variety reports the three-year deal <a href="https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/spotify-call-her-daddy-alex-cooper-exclusive-1234996840/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is valued</a> at more than $60 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some background for the non-Daddy gang: <em>Call Her Daddy</em> is the fifth-most popular podcast on Spotify and consistently in the top 15 across all platforms. The raunchy pod was originally co-hosted by Alex Cooper and Sofia Franklyn—before a contract dispute with Barstool split the duo.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What this deal means for Spotify:</strong> The company continues to ramp up its investments in podcasts. It's previously struck exclusive deals with the Obamas, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, and Joe Rogan (not a list we expected to write today) and acquired podcast companies including Gimlet and Anchor. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it means for Barstool: </strong>CEO Erika Nardini <a href="https://open.spotify.com/episode/5UHavNhyrmprXy2qLb1nM0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said on her podcast</a> yesterday that host Alex Cooper will "still be partnering with Barstool Sports," but not on podcasts. Instead, watch out for a newsletter and merchandise platform.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong><em>Call Her Daddy </em>will start airing exclusively on Spotify July 21.</p>

meeting. And after two executive departures Monday, Lordstown Motors \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/15/lordstown-motors-shares-soar-after-new-chairwoman-says-production-plans-remain-on-track.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erebounded\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e after its new chairwoman said production for its electric pickup was on track.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe US death toll from the coronavirus \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-600k-deaths-us-1ef14a0b998e6ce99281edf6e996dfbe?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped 600,000\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday, roughly equal to the number of people who died of cancer in 2019. New York \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/new-york-covid-vaccine-restrictions-lifted-5236ddaa-0bf4-4305-b568-3e649269bbc4.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elifted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e nearly all Covid-related restrictions after the state partially vaccinated 70% of adults.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! She is smiling at the camera with her hair falling in loose waves around her face.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDQ5L2RvX25vdF91c2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTaylor Hill/FilmMagic via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, MacKenzie Scott announced she \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/mackenzie-scott-donation-7f936f59-2ab7-4616-b824-bafe6cbf4ce7.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edonated\u003c/a\u003e $2.7 billion to 286 organizations working to address issues including poverty, racial equity, and higher education.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn her 2019 divorce settlement with Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, Scott received a 4% slice of Amazon, which was worth $36 billion at the time. Thanks to the company's rising valuation, today she's the world's 20th wealthiest person.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut she's not like other billionaires\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe speed and volume of Scott's giving, as well as the types of organizations she's supporting, is \"highly unconventional,\" the NYT \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/15/business/mackenzie-scott-philanthropy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInstead of splashing her name across a big foundation or philanthropic effort like, just for the sake of example, her ex-husband's Bezos Earth Fund, Scott focuses on direct giving to smaller institutions that may be passed over by the biggest donors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast year, she \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/features/2021-bezos-scott-philanthropy/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edispersed\u003c/a\u003e $6 billion in what is believed to be a record annual sum by a living person. And there's plenty more where that came from: Like some other billionaires who have pledged to give away their fortune, Scott's wealth continues to grow faster than she can spend it; Forbes estimates her current net worth at $60 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWill Jeff follow suit? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2020, Bezos created a $10 billion climate change fund and announced the first ~$800 million in grants. He's expected to be slower dishing out his fortune while he decides how to maximize its impact.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut donations from Scott's and Bezos's Amazon fortunes can be a catch-22 for activists, who on the one hand may not want money tinted by a large carbon footprint and allegations of labor abuse...but on the other hand could really use the funds.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAs a recent ProPublica report reminded us, many billionaires' wealth is structured in such a way that they \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/08/propublica-estimates-richest-25-individuals-pay-34-tax-rate?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epay next to nothing\u003c/a\u003e in income taxes. Scott acknowledged wealth disparities in a Medium post announcing her donations yesterday, writing, \"It would be better if disproportionate wealth were not concentrated in a small number of hands, and that the solutions are best designed and implemented by others.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Experience Economy Is Back\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRetail sales \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/retail-sales-health-coronavirus-pandemic-business-493f964f22362fbc5fc97f895b6f408b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell 1.3%\u003c/a\u003e in May, which may not seem that important or interesting until you consider how it reflects major changes in the post-Covid economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's going on: \u003c/strong\u003ePeople are paying less for \u003cem\u003ethings\u003c/em\u003e, like sweatpants, and more for \u003cem\u003eexperiences\u003c/em\u003e, like things you shouldn't do in sweatpants. This is the opposite of what happened during the pandemic, when people could really only buy...things. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo illustrate the point, restaurant sales have \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/jonathanmaze/status/1404896377566601216/photo/1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeclipsed\u003c/a\u003e grocery sales for the first time since March of last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDUxL3Jlc3RhdXJhbnRfc2FsZXNfdnNfZ3JvY2VyeV9zYWxlc19jaGFydC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"Restaurant sales vs. grocery sales chart\" data-source=\"Restaurant Business\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003eRestaurant Business\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLess spending on goods and more spending on services could bring \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-15/u-s-retail-sales-decline-after-two-solid-months-of-gains?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebetter balance\u003c/a\u003e to the off-kilter economy. The surge in demand for physical products last year caused supply chains to become more tangled than your headphones, sending consumer prices higher. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlong with alleviating pressure on supply chains, more services spending means people are finally enjoying experiences they couldn't during the pandemic, like vacations and live music.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eConsumer spending has rebounded from the 2020 recession, but stimulus payments, supply chain bottlenecks, and business reopenings are clouding the long-term picture. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd only Spotify. The not-just-music streamer has purchased the exclusive rights to the \u003cem\u003eCall Her Daddy\u003c/em\u003e podcast from Barstool Sports. Variety reports the three-year deal \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/spotify-call-her-daddy-alex-cooper-exclusive-1234996840/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis valued\u003c/a\u003e at more than $60 million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome background for the non-Daddy gang: \u003cem\u003eCall Her Daddy\u003c/em\u003e is the fifth-most popular podcast on Spotify and consistently in the top 15 across all platforms. The raunchy pod was originally co-hosted by Alex Cooper and Sofia Franklyn—before a contract dispute with Barstool split the duo.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat this deal means for Spotify:\u003c/strong\u003e The company continues to ramp up its investments in podcasts. It's previously struck exclusive deals with the Obamas, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, and Joe Rogan (not a list we expected to write today) and acquired podcast companies including Gimlet and Anchor. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it means for Barstool: \u003c/strong\u003eCEO Erika Nardini \u003ca href=\"https://open.spotify.com/episode/5UHavNhyrmprXy2qLb1nM0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid on her podcast\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that host Alex Cooper will \"still be partnering with Barstool Sports,\" but not on podcasts. Instead, watch out for a newsletter and merchandise platform.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003eCall Her Daddy \u003c/em\u003ewill start airing exclusively on Spotify July 21.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
